q:
If A has an eigen value L and B has an eigen vector x w.r.t. the eigen
value m, then ABx = Lmx.

If L is an eigen value of A and m is an eigen value of B, then Lm is an
eigen value of AB.
The eigen values of A equal to the eigen values of A^{T}.
If A has an eigen value 0, then A is singular.
If A has distinct eigen values, then A is diagonalizable.
If A has repeated eigen values, then A is not diagonalizable.

Suppose A is a 3 by 3 matrix with eigen values 1, 2 and 4. Please compute
the trace of A^{2}.

Suppose A is a 3 by 3 matrix with eigen values 1, 2 and 4. Please compute
the eigen values of A^{-1}.

Suppose A is a 3 by 3 matrix with eigen values 1, 2 and 4. Please compute
the eigen values of (A^{2} + I)^{-1}.

Let A be a 2 by 2 matrix. If tr(A) = 7 and det(A) = 12, what are the eigen
values of A.

If a_{0} = 2, a_{1} = 3 and a_{n + 1} = 3a_{n} - 2a_{n - 1}, for all
a >= 1, find the formula for a_{n}.
